definition[0]: the time when a computer is not working
definition[1]: a period of time when you have finished what you were doing, and you can relax or do something that you had not originally planned to do
example[0]: Often, during semesters, you have down time when you can do some exercise.
definition[2]: time lost in producing goods because something has gone wrong, for example because a machine has broken or materials have not arrived
example[1]: loss of revenue due to downtime
example[2]: With less downtime at the plant, customers can start to expect significant savings.
definition[3]: time lost on a computer NETWORK (=a system of connected computers) because the system is not working properly
example[3]: Last year alone, computer downtime cost the company $4,000 in lost productivity.
